column1: Today I introduced a bill with Rep. @boblatta to do just that and I urge my colleagues to support this legislation and pass the EXTEND Act.

Rural Broadband is a necessity and the Coronavirus pandemic has put a spotlight on this issue. When Congress approves stimulus funds states should be able to use that money to expand their broadband infrastructure. https://t.co/YkAlqqfHvy
Proud to participate in today’s @USChamber discussion about the programs and people that will drive the next era of human deep space exploration!

This action promotes national awareness of adoption celebrates children and families involved in adoption and encourages the people of the United States to secure safety permanency and well-being for all children.

It’s been a whole week since the election and votes are still being counted. That is unacceptable.   This slow count undermines the integrity of this election especially since these votes are still trickling in from Democrat leaning counties.  It’s November 10th!
Congrats to the #1 team in the nation! @AlabamaFTBL https://t.co/UGWgh851l3

As I stated Friday every legal vote should be counted. Presidential Elections are over when the votes are certified and the Electoral College meets in December. President Trump has every right to legally challenge any state results and to seek a recount where appropriate.
Below is a link to my statement about the current status of the U.S. Presidential Election:  https://t.co/EltoQr7bIM https://t.co/r2VL4IO60Z

The brave men and women who serve our nation are heroes to us all and it’s up to us to honor them.  This month please join @America250 for their November Salute by uploading a picture of a military service member or veteran who has touched your life. https://t.co/L6bgjrmQuI
Thank you for the overwhelming support for another term in the United States House of Representatives. It is truly my honor to serve you everyday in Congress.

Happy 100th Birthday Radio!  On this day in 1920 the first radio broadcast in the United States is made from Pittsburgh. The way we get information & entertainment changed forever. And 100 years later radio is still an important part of our lives. @ALBroadcasters https://t.co/tEaMLP3uk1
✅ Small and large businesses are reopening their doors ✅ Operation Warp Speed is working to get 300 million doses of a COVID-19 vaccine by January

This Halloween don’t let Democrat scare tactics about our country and our President haunt you. The truth is in the facts.   ✅ The American economy is making a comeback with a historic GDP surge of 33.1% ✅ Unemployment claims are dropping
We were at NorthRidge Fitness one of the thousands of businesses that took advantage of the Paycheck Protection Program we created in Congress to help businesses get through the pandemic. @nfib_al

Congratulations to Amy Coney Barrett on her confirmation to the Supreme Court. She will make a great justice and decide cases based on the Constitution and the law.
I welcome USDA’s announcement of $37 million to expand rural broadband in Alabama.  https://t.co/7ngCMLWzLK

Expanding rural broadband brings opportunities for businesses better educational tools for our kids and opens access to telehealth for the vulnerable. I was proud to create the ReConnect program in the 2018 Appropriations Bill.

I applaud President Trump for making such a great nomination Amy Coney Barrett will make an excellent Supreme Court Justice.

The nomination of Amy Coney Barrett to be the next Associate Justice of the Supreme Court is a big win for this country. She is a defender of free speech a protector of the Constitution and an advocate for the most vulnerable among us.

The House of Representatives has no say in matters of choosing a new justice but I support Senator McConnell in his role as the Senate Majority Leader to guide the nation through this process.

The Constitution clearly defines how a new justice is to be placed on the Supreme Court. It’s ultimately up to the President to nominate someone and it is the privilege of the Senate to decide when and if a nominee gets a vote.

Justice Ginsberg served the court faithfully for a quarter of a century.  She was respected and admired for her dedication to her work to her friends and as a pioneer on the Court. She will be missed.

This has been one of my top priorities and something I was proud to help deliver when Ag Appropriations Chairman. Look forward to seeing more projects constructed around the state in the coming years. There is a lot of work ahead but it will make a big difference for Alabama ag.

Today 75 years later there are roughly 300000 American WWII veterans still alive. To those from the Greatest Generation who served our country both living and past thank you for your service!

September 2 1945 is a day that has been etched in the pages of American history. It marked the official end of World War II with American soldiers and officials watching as Japanese Foreign Minister Mamoru Shigemitsu signed formal surrender documents aboard the U.S.S. Missouri. https://t.co/NIIVWrhKd8

This would expand competition giving farmers more options to bring their produce to market and alleviate current backlogs building a stronger food supply chain.  I will continue to fight for legislation and policy that benefits the American farmer and consumer.
I was pleased to be an original cosponsor of the RAMP-UP Act which would offer grants and loans to smaller processors enabling them to comply with federal food safety standards.

After their initial findings USDA outlined a series of policy proposals.    For instance USDA recognized the high burden for smaller meat processors meeting federal guidelines and noted “a resurgence in demand for services provided by these small and very small processors”.

Though I am pleased to see progress from the investigation I will monitor closely as USDA and DOJ continue to assess whether any violations of the Packers and Stockyards Act or Antitrust laws occurred.

USDA has outlined initial findings from its ongoing investigation into cattle and beef price disruptions following COVID-19 and the Holcomb plant fire. In May I joined my colleagues in urging Sec. Perdue to conclude their investigation as quickly as possible.

Today is the 51st anniversary of @NASA 's Apollo 11.  I am proud of the thousands of Americans who play a role in designing and completing the @NASA_SLS which like the Saturn V was designed from the beginning to provide astronauts safe passage to the Moon once again.

It was truly an honor to serve with him. No matter the subject he spoke on John was always passionate and commanded the floor of the House of Representatives. My condolences and prayers to his family.

I’m sorry to hear of the passing of my colleague and fellow Alabama native Congressman John Lewis. My daughter and I had the opportunity to visit Selma with John on the 50th Anniversary of Bloody Sunday back in 2015 and saw up close his passion for Civil Rights.

When times called for cooperation Speaker Pelosi chose partisanship. When America needed to come together to address the remaining needs of COVID-19 Democratic leadership chose to go their own way.

Unfortunately the Phase 4 stimulus has gone in a different direction. Speaker Pelosi has chosen to use this moment to write a wish list of liberal policies meant to divide the country as not a single Republican was involved in developing this bill.

In the last two months Congress has passed three economic relief packages with a great deal of bipartisan support. These bills weren’t perfect but they were necessary to combat COVID-19. We knew we needed to work together and we did.
